title: BBC Local Live: Greater Manchester on Friday 24 June 2016 - BBC News
summary: the uk votes to leave the european union and cameron is to step down .
wigan mp and remain backer lisa nandy tells people 'do n't panic ' .
stockport mp anne coffey calls for vote of no confidence in jeremy corbyn .
fomer sale sharks star danny cipriani found guilty of drink-driving .
man stabbed 20 times in salford 'attempted murder ' .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates from greater manchester have finished for the day , but we 'll be back from 08:00 on monday with the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the region .

documents.title: north west mep understands immigration concerns
text: north west conservative mep sajjad karim believes the eu referendum shows immigration was a key issue to many britons .

mr karim backed the remain campaign but said : `` it 's quite clear that in many of our northern towns there are working class communities that have been affected by free movement of people for work .
`` it 's sent a very clear message that many of them have voted because of the immigration issues not having been addressed . ''

documents.title: travel : roadworks causing congestion in sale
text: traffic is queuing up in sale due to roadworks between harboro way and park road .
more from bbc travel
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: weather : showers to make way for clear night
text: any showers should ease away tonight to leave many places dry with clear spells .
however , rain could continue to affect some areas , and may feel fresher than recent nights .
more from bbc weather

documents.title: coming up
text: on tonight 's programme we 'll bring you a full round-up of the day 's events , as the uk voted to leave the european union .
manchester had the strongest remain vote in the north west - but the majority of districts in the region voted to leave .
what next for the north west ?
join us on bbc one from 18:30
author: Roger Johnson
Presenter, BBC North West Tonight

documents.title: business leaders accept brexit result despite many of them having backed remain
text: the chief executive of the greater manchester chamber of commerce says the group will accept the outcome of the eu referendum despite backing the remain campaign .
clive memmott said : whilst a majority of our members will be disappointed with this result , the public has made its views clear .
`` it is vital that the government and the wider electorate accept this result and work together through the coming period of uncertainty . ''

documents.title: man stabbed 20 times in salford 'attempted murder '
text: a man has been stabbed more than 20 times by three men wearing balaclavas in an attack police are treating as attempted murder .
the men jumped from a car and attacked him as he was walking by the citrus way and mango place junction in pendleton , salford , at 23:15 on thursday .
they stabbed the 23-year-old victim before getting back into the car which was driven away by a fourth person .

documents.title: mp says labour leader jeremy corbyn should resign over brexit result
text: furious stockport mp ann coffey has sent shockwaves through the labour party by tabling a motion of no confidence against jeremy corbyn - declaring herself 'angry beyond belief ' at the eu referendum result .
author: Manchester Evening News
Manchester Evening News

documents.title: how will brexit affect the northern powerhouse ?
text: the uk 's vote to exit the european union makes the case of the northern powerhouse project more compelling than ever .
author: Manchester Evening News
Manchester Evening News

documents.title: latest headlines in greater manchester and east cheshire
text: this afternoon 's top stories :

documents.title: tyson fury postpones wladimir klitschko rematch
text: manchester-born world heavyweight champion tyson fury has postponed next month 's rematch with wladimir klitschko after injuring an ankle in training .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: rugby star found guilty of drink-driving
text: england and sale sharks rugby star danny cipriani has been found guilty of drinking and driving after his mercedes crashed into a minicab following a night out .
westminster magistrates ' court heard the wasps fly-half was so drunk his eyes were `` glazed '' after the smash on imperial road , fulham on 1 june 2015 .
the 28-year-old was ordered to pay a total of £ 7,620 in fines and costs and banned from driving for 18 months .

documents.title: slovak ex-pats 'shocked ' by brexit vote
text: how will the result of the referendum affect workers from eu countries who currently live in the uk ?
what about those wanting to move here in future ?
members of the slovakian ex-pat community in warrington have been giving their views .

documents.title: pound to dollar exchange rate plunges after brexit
text: in the space of just a few hours overnight , the british pound dropped to its lowest level in more than 30 years .
author: Manchester Evening News
Manchester Evening News

documents.title: eu referendum : analysing how manchester voted
text: it was in the more deprived north of greater manchester where most voters plumped for brexit .
in rochdale , oldham , tameside and wigan more than 60 % voted to leave - a sign of the long-simmering frustration over immigration and its perceived impact on jobs .
manchester , stockport and trafford came in for remain but with an overall average of about 55 % , greater manchester 's leave voters made a big contribution to the national result .
author: Kevin Fitzpatrick
BBC Radio Manchester journalist

documents.title: tennis : stockport 's broady to face andy murray at wimbledon
text: stockport 's liam broady has been drawn against world number two andy murray in the men 's singles first round at wimbledon .
his sister , naomi , will face ukrainian elina svitolina in the women 's singles .
the tournament gets under way on monday .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: latest headlines in greater manchester and east cheshire
text: this afternoon 's top stories :

documents.title: 'ghost of a tree ' unveiled in manchester park
text: former turner prize nominee anya gallaccio 's `` ghost of a tree '' has been unveiled in manchester 's whitworth park this morning .
the stainless steel work stands on the spot of the only tree that was taken down during the recent renovation of the whitworth gallery .
apparently , when gallaccio heard about its demise - it had to be taken down as it was already dying - it sparked the idea for her work .
author: Chris Long
Entertainment reporter

documents.title: greg dyke : effect of brexit vote on football 'depends on exit terms '
text: speaking at the national football museum in manchester , fa chairman greg dyke said :

`` the eu has already had an effect on football with bosman ( the 1995 european court ruling which banned restrictions on eu players in national leagues and allowed out of contract players to leave a club for free ) .
`` what happens in the future is going to depend on the exit terms but football is already an international game .
it 's too early to say if this will be detrimental to the game or not . ''

documents.title: eu referendum : recap of results across greater manchester
text: here 's a recap of everything you need to know about the eu referendum results in manchester .
the city had the strongest remain vote in the north west - but the majority of districts in the area voted to leave .

documents.title: partington paper mill blaze still smouldering
text: firefighters have spent the night tackling a large blaze at a paper mill in partington - and it was still smouldering this afternoon .
the fire broke out yesterday afternoon , involving about 400 tonnes of waste paper .

documents.title: roger hunt visits his plaque at the football museum walk of fame
text: world cup legend roger hunt views his plaque on the new walk of fame at the national football museum in manchester .

documents.title: man stabbed 20 times in salford 'attempted murder '
text: a man was stabbed more than 20 times by three balaclava-wearing men in salford in an attack police are treating as attempted murder .
the 23-year-old was walking near the junction of citrus way and mango place in pendleton when the men carried out the assault at about 23:15 on thursday , before escaping in a car .
the victim remains in a stable condition , and detectives are appealing for witnesses .

documents.title: eu referendum : stockport and trafford back remain campaign
text: along with manchester , people in trafford and stockport are facing up to leaving the eu despite a majority backing the remain campaign .

documents.title: rugby league : wigan warriors sign new zealand international
text: wigan warriors have signed the nrl grand final winner and world cup finalist frank-paul nuuausala from australian club canberra raiders .
nuuausala joins wigan with immediate effect on a three-and-a-half-year deal .
he is expected to arrive in the uk in the next few weeks .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: youngsters relish rhs flower show challenge despite vandal attack
text: schoolchildren in sale are determined to show their work at the rhs tatton park flower show , despite their display being vandalised .
intruders broke into the polytunnel at lime tree primary academy and destroyed most of the plants .

documents.title: brexit win in greater manchester despite city 's strong remain vote
text: manchester had the strongest remain vote in the north west - but the majority of districts in the area voted to leave the european union .
in greater manchester , manchester voted 60.4 % to stay , followed by trafford at 57.7 % and stockport at 52.3 % .
wigan , tameside and oldham at 63.9 % , 61.1 % and 60.9 % respectively topped the leave votes .

documents.title: eu referendum : a reminder of the final results in greater manchester
text: bolton : leave 80,491 / remain 57,589
bury : leave 54,674 / remain 46,354
manchester : leave 79,991 / remain 121,823
oldham : leave 65,369 / remain 42,034
rochdale : leave 62,014 / remain 41,217
stockport : leave 77,930 / remain 85,559
tameside : leave 67,829 / remain 43,118
trafford : leave 53,018 / remain 72,293
wigan : leave 104,331 / remain 58,942
cheshire east : leave 113,163 / remain 107,962

documents.title: stockport mp in call for no confidence vote in labour leader
text: two labour mps have submitted a motion of no confidence in labour leader jeremy corbyn .
stockport 's anne coffey and margaret hodge confirmed the move in a letter to the chairman of the parliamentary labour party .

documents.title: latest headlines for greater manchester and east cheshire
text: this afternoon 's top stories :

documents.title: interim mayor tony lloyd : 'region will flourish ' despite brexit vote
text: the interim mayor for greater manchester has said manchester will continue to flourish despite the uk voting in favour of leaving the european union .
manchester backed the remain campaign with a majority of more than 40,000 .
`` it is no secret that this is not the result greater manchester leaders had hoped for , '' said tony lloyd .
`` but gm is a vibrant and resilient place .
`` our city-region will continue to transform and grow , driven by the talent and determination of our people . ''

documents.title: watch : how the eu referendum has left one family divided
text: they were a family divided .
the father voted leave , while the mother and son voted remain .
now the awan family from altrincham have spoken about what they think the result will mean .

documents.title: 'it turns out that the country agrees with me ' - bury mp 's delight at brexit vote
text: david nuttall has expressed his delight at britain 's decision to leave the eu .
author: Bury Times
Bury Times

documents.title: former sale sharks star convicted of drink-driving
text: former sale sharks rugby star danny cipriani has been found guilty of drinking and driving after he crashed his mercedes into a minicab following a night out .
westminster magistrates ' court heard the fly-half was so drunk his eyes were `` glazed '' after the smash in fulham on 1 june 2015 .
the 28-year-old , now with wasps , was found to be over twice the drink-drive limit .
he was ordered to pay a total of £ 7,620 in fines and costs and banned from driving for 18 months .

documents.title: what happens now that we have left the eu ?
text: what happens next following britain 's historic vote to leave the european union ?
it 's the $ 64,000 question , the one that ran through the core of our entire referendum debate .
author: Manchester Evening News
Manchester Evening News

documents.title: eu referendum : manchester voted to remain in the eu
text: bury , wigan and bolton voted to leave the eu , manchester backed the remain campaign .

documents.title: latest headlines for greater manchester and east cheshire
text: this morning 's top stories :

documents.title: watch : eu referendum result declared in manchester
text: this is the moment the electoral commission announced the uk voted to leave the eu at manchester town hall .
the electoral commission officially announces that the uk has voted to leave the eu at manchester town hall .

documents.title: eu referendum : how did your area vote ?
text: rochdale , oldham , tameside and salford also voted to leave .

documents.title: david nuttall mp : result must be respected
text: leave campaigner and .
bury north 's conservative mp david nuttall has thanked his constituents after 54 % of people in bury voted for brexit .
bury votes to leave eu many thanks to all who voted
- were you # remain or # leave david ?
just so that i know how to vote at the next ge

-thanks for that - my job and those of my 4 colleagues working for taiwan company now likely to move to slovakia .
thks again

- deafening and predictable silence .
probably because he has no truthful answers .
'no truthful answers ' seems like the fashion these days .
why let the facts get in the way eh ?
- needs to grow a pair and admit he was part of a charade and deception based on what we now know to lies .
he wo n't
well done david , here 's to the rest of the night !

documents.title: eu referendum : how did your area vote ?
text: the political landscape across the european union has changed dramatically overnight with voters backing the uk 's exit .
bolton , wigan and bury voted for brexit .

documents.title: eu referendum : north west towns vote leave as cities votes remain
text: people in many north west towns voted to leave the eu , while liverpool and manchester voted remain .
in bury 54,674 people ( 54.1 % ) voted to leave , while 46,354 ( 45.9 % ) voted to stay , during the first declaration in the region .
turnout was high , with 71.3 % of the electorate voting .

documents.title: eu referendum : what happens next
text: the process for the uk 's withdrawal from the european union is not a simple process .

documents.title: eu leave surprise for blackley and broughton mp
text: the only greater manchester labour mp to back the eu referendum leave campaign has admitted he is `` slightly surprised , but absolutely delighted '' .
the country voted in favour of leaving the european union .
graham stringer , the mp for blackley and broughton , said `` it was a huge mistake for the uk to join the european union .
we gave control of our laws away and we paid for the privilege .
`` now we 've taken control back i 'm delighted and we can look to the future . ''

documents.title: eu referendum : complete rundown of voting figures
text: see how your area voted across greater manchester

documents.title: eu referendum : bbc north west tonight political editor arif ansari
text: what is unexpected is the number of areas in the north west that have voted to leave by big majorities .
most people were expecting quite close results .
but large parts of the region have overwhelmingly chosen to quit europe , sometimes with larger turnouts than at the previous general election .
the old mill towns of lancashire and greater manchester want out .
so do large parts of merseyside .
why ?
during the campaign i met voters who felt they had got nothing from the eu and were determined to stop further immigration .
liverpool , wirral and manchester have voted to remain .
the cities are more at ease with immigration and have benefited from eu regeneration money .
author: Arif Ansari
Politics correspondent, BBC North West Tonight

documents.title: latest headlines from greater manchester and east cheshire
text: this morning 's top stories

documents.title: breakingbreaking : prime minister david cameron to resign by october after eu referendum vote
text: the prime minister david cameron has announced at downing street that he is to step down following confirmation that voters have backed brexit .

documents.title: watch : official announcement the uk votes for brexit
text: the electoral commission officially announces that the uk has voted to leave the eu at manchester town hall .

documents.title: official declaration : uk votes leave
text: chief counting officer jenny watson , speaking at manchester town hall , says she has certified 33,577,342 votes in the eu referendum .
the total for remain was 16,141,241 , while the total for leave was 17,410,742 .
national turnout was 72.2 % .
author: Arif Ansari
Politics correspondent, BBC North West Tonight

documents.title: let us know your thoughts on the eu referendum
text: alison butterworth and phil trow want your thoughts on the confirmation that the uk will leave the european union .
did your family vote the same way as you or are there divided opinions ?
let us know via email , facebook or twitter
morning .
have your say @ twitterid uk votes to # leave the european union .
what lies ahead ?

documents.title: brexit supporter positive about vote to leave eu
text: the mp for bolton west , chris green , believes the uk can hold its place on the world stage despite a vote to leave the eu .
`` we can still keep a great relationship with our european friends but also look to the united states and indo-china .
`` brexit is a huge change for britain but we do n't want to change everything at the same time . ''
more than 58 % of eligible voters in bolton backed the leave campaign .

documents.title: brexit worries for wigan labour mp lisa nandy
text: the mp for wigan is concerned over the impact of the uk 's withdrawal from the eu .
wigan voted strongly for brexit and remain campaigner lisa nandy fears it will impact negatively on her constituents .

documents.title: latest headlines for greater manchester and east cheshire
text: this morning 's top eu referendum stories :

documents.title: eu referendum : greater manchester voting figures
text: bolton : leave 80,491 / remain 57,589
bury : leave 54,674 / remain 46,354
manchester : leave 79,991 / remain 121,823
oldham : leave 65,369 / remain 42,034
rochdale : leave 62,014 / remain 41,217
stockport : leave 77,930 / remain 85,559
tameside : leave 67,829 / remain 43,118
trafford : leave 53,018 / remain 72,293
wigan : leave 104,331 / remain 58,942

documents.title: eu referendum : greater manchester voters back leave campaign
text: across greater manchester , 55 % of people voted to leave the european union - and 45 % voted to remain - after an historic night for the uk .
bolton , wigan , bury , rochdale , oldham , tameside and salford all voted in favour of leaving the eu .
cheshire east also voted to leave .
only manchester , trafford and stockport voted to remain .
the referendum turnout in the uk was 71.8 % with more than 30 million people voting - the highest turnout at a uk election since 1992 .

documents.title: uk votes to leave eu in historic referendum
text: britain has voted to leave the european union in a sensational snub to the political establishment .
with more than 90 % of the referendum results in , those who want to quit are ahead by more than one million .
the bbc is forecasting a victory for the leave campaign by 52 % to 48 % .

documents.title: weather : sunny with thundery showers
text: a day of sunshine and showers , some of which will turn heavy and thundery as daytime temperatures begin to rise .
there will be some dry weather around too , where it will feel warm in the sunshine .
more from bbc weather
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's coverage
text: welcome to greater manchester live .
we 're here until 18:00 reflecting on a momentous day for the uk with all the latest news from the eu referendum .
we also have the latest local news , sport , travel and weather updates from across the 10 boroughs and east cheshire .
you can get in touch with all your photographs and snippets of news by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Jon Lowe
Reporter, BBC News Online
